name: Hotel Monna Lisa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this hotel so much I was sad to leave. The room was beautiful, the breakfast was delicious, the staff was extremely welcoming and helpful, the location totally central to everything and the gardens were beautiful. We were so happy here, we could have stayed another 3 nights! I highly recommend this charming hotel to anyone visiting Florence.
reviews.title: Totally charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were recommended this hotel by friends... we have really good friends. This is a charmer. Great location, lovely setting and extremely helpful staff. Drinks in the garden in the afternoon - good breakfast and an eager staff willing to help with restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: A gem in Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like quiet, quaint and away from the crowds yet near the action, this is the place for you. iterally you are only a 10 minute walk from the Duomo or the Academia gallery. Lots of great little restaraunts and bistros nearby. The garden at the hotel is a nice respite from a day of site seeing. We sat in the garden sipping wine and enjoying a great autumn evening. The staff is extremely professional and helpful. Breakfast is top notch in both variety and service by the staff. We will definitely stay there again when we go back to the beautiful city of Florence.
reviews.title: The Best Little Hotel Near the Duomo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 3 nights in this hotel, I had reviewed it before booking and studyed there webb sight. It was quite exspensive 537 euro's.for three nights.We had stayed in Pisa the first night in a lovely hotel and half the price. When we arrived we were shown a room which was so small not even standard double size, we told the porter that it was not what we booked or payed for.We were then shown a larger room but not much larger, they had no other rooms available.The room was ok on the surface but after beening there three days the room and hotel showed that it was shabby dirty and in need off a coat of paint.Breakfast service great but food average nothing to shout about.The hotel is a old monerstry lots of stairs lots of charector shame that they have not taken care off the cleaniness of the hotel. I left a list off this wrong when we stayed there. Did not think I would get a reply but I did. They have apologiesed and offered us two free nights stay on our return to Florence.
reviews.title: Big disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about our four-night stay was magical. It is all well and good to say that hotel accommodations do not matter much as one is not in the room for much of the day, but I believe that they do matter, and in fact a great deal. Everyone at this former Renaissance palace was unfailingly warm and helpful, from the front desk (special thanks to Regina at the front desk for arranging a hair salon appointment for us) to the gardener, to the bellman, to the very gracious wait staff. Breakfast was perfect, too, including the espresso. Wonderful location--we never felt unsafe and were able to walk just about anywhere. We hope to return--hopefully, for a longer stay.
reviews.title: Unforgettable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a reason that this place is listed in the best hotels in the world book. The artwork and architecture are breathtaking, the staff warm and accommodating, and the location is superb. Off season rates were beyond compare. Little touches like pumice stones in the bath and complimentary champagne upon arrival makes you feel as if you are, in fact, royalty. The history of the place is fascinating. I would move in if I could. We look forward to coming back again.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B & B was very well located and was warm & inviting. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were great. Our only complaint is the shower/tub leaked all over the bathroom floor every time we showered, that is why they did not get 5 stars. The breakfast was very good. We loved going out to the gardens at the end of our day and exploring the nooks out there. Would recommened this hotel but beware the leaky tub.
reviews.title: Charming ambience and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: As the other reviews stated, it is like being transported in time. The hotel has a authentic palace look, with sitting rooms scattered throughout and windows that open out to the beautiful garden. There is about 20 stairs to walk up tp the second floor, but we were used to stairs and walking at this point in our vacation. What makes this hotel charming is the wait staff. They were all so friendly and helpful. The location was awesome. Walking distance to the Duomo, Accademia, Ufizi, and the Ponte Vecchio bridge.
reviews.title: Charming Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice, cosy, central, with serviceminded and very nice staff, both in the reception and in the bar. 5 minutes to walk to the Dome. I will stay here next time I'm going to Florence.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with charming staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only breakfast restaurant. (For dinner I reccomend restaurant: La Giostra, 200 m away in the same street;Borgo Pinti).
reviews.title: A Garden Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Monna Lisa during New Year's Eve in Florence. This was my 3rd visit to the hotel, and I must say that the Hotel Monna Lisa has retained its greatness.
reviews.title: Great Location In Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are large and very comfortable, and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The front desk staff are always friendly and helpful, and the hotel's central location in Florence makes all the tourist attractions easily accessible by walking. There is also on-site parking available for a fee which is a rare occurence within Florence.
reviews.title: Look away now if you dont want to see the peeling paint - but it still has lots of high points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for either business or leisure travelers. The Hotel Monna Lisa has not lost its allure over these many years.
reviews.title: stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Monna Lisa in November 2012 in two (very ancient) rooms. They had the highest ceilings that I have ever encountered but were genuinely ancient and not terribly comfortable. Although meant to be romantic tbh they just came across as old and dusty. The en-suite bathrooms were of the elderly variety and I have never climbed such steep stairs to get to the rooms without a harness attachment! We did ask for the rooms to be adjoining or next door to each other when booking but this did not happen - as we were staying in a big group it worked out ok as we knew all of the other guests at this level but when travelling with small kids it is an added issue. IN some parts of this very old palace the paint is peeling and the it looks like its better days were many moons ago but this is Florence so somehow it works where in any other city it would not. The street that this hotel is on is quite genuinely more like an alleyway so the front is not very impressive but it is nice on the inside. There is a more modern section to this hotel and i would advise booking that as the older section is just a bit too old. However the staff were the nicest and most helpful that I have met anywhere and really did add to the very enjoyable stay. The car park out the back is a God send and the directions and sat nav codes supplied by the hotel will get you through the warren of streets without too much difficulty. Food in the mornings was more than adequete and the buffet spread, attentive staff and hot chololate kept both kids and adults happy. The kids found many nooks and crannies to play in and there was never any sense of the staff getting annoyed with this as can happen elsewhere. And the best bit was the bill - it was correct and nothing more added. They had advertised 4 nights for the price of 3 and that is what we got. The staff are the real high point here and I think if the rooms ( 5 and 9) had not been quite so old fashioned it would have been perfect.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was my 2nd stay here and the first for my 18 year old niece. we were both thrilled with everything. beautiful common areas. the staff is friendly and helpful. our room was unique and so comfy. i only wish i had more than 2 nights. the breakfast was quite nice and plentiful. very close to all attractions. walking from the train station was not bad with light luggage. i will always return to this hotel when i visit florence.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Monna Lisa was just the right combination of quality and price, making it a great value. Our double room was comfortable and well-appointed, the housekeeping was excellent and the staff was friendly, helpful, engaging, and attentive. The breakfast had excellent coffee and a reasonable variety of items. All of the places that we wanted to go were within reasonable walking distance, yet the surroundings were very quiet. We found the eclectic collection of "alternate takes" on the Mona Lisa painting to be quite entertaining as well. The only negative was that WiFi service was fairly expensive. We highly recommend this hotel and are looking forward to returning upon our next visit to Florence.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: we had a double room, with an extra bed brought in for a third person. Sept 28-30; 3 nights-
reviews.title: Too expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $1226.00. includes tax and parking. but at $380.00/ night, they still did not offer free WiFi; an extra 15 euro/day. The breakfast was completely average, just a basic table with bread, cereal and fruit, no chef. We had a water leak in our shower which flooded the room, but it was not corrected, only cleaned up after, for three days. No offer to change room. Other than this, the garden is very nice, a very convenient location.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really nice and pretty hotel, well communicated to everything, short walk to all attractions and train station. The garden was beautiful, but the staff was the best out of it, everyone was willing to help and make your staying in Florence better. Highly recommended, love to come back.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mona Lisa Hotel is a beautiful and charming hotel that is located just close enough to the centre of Florence to walk everywhere but away from the madding crowds. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful! We stayed for a long weekend with our five kids and enjoyed large rooms and public spaces. The breakfast was excellent and although the setting was very elegant our kids were never made to feel uncomfortable. Quiet and peacefull and just a ten minute walk from most major attractions. If you are looking for value for money,pretty, spacious rooms, friendly staff and a good breakfast with an authentic Italian feel then the Mona Lisa is the right choice. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Best small hotel in Florence

description: Charming Ornate Hotel featuring original works of art, occupying two floors of a 14th-century Palace near the Duomo.
